scene.title: 生きて
scene.text: Li Sushang took a lot of effort to put the unconscious Raksha into the bed.
Her head was still groggy, and her whole body was in pain when she moved her fingers. This is so, she still relied on perseverance to just accomplish this great cause.
After covering the Raksha with the quilt, she sat aside and sang a song that was out of tune.
This tune suddenly appeared in her mind, like a dead leaf drifting to the shore.
Ah, when did she hear this song and who sang it?
Inexplicably, Sushang remembered the appearance of her mother, Qin Suyi.
Suyi, in white garments, squatted in front of her to reach out and stroke her hair gently.
scene.dialog: [At such a young age, it's really hard for you to go to learn martial arts outside the Great Wall for your mother. But Mommy will arrange everything. In the future, when you are successful in mastering swordsmanship, no one in this world will dare to bully us.]
[Mommy has a lot of hardships, and if I told you now, you wouldn't understand. In this world, many things are beyond your control. But…]
“You have to live, Sushang, you have to live… promise me."
scene.text: The girl's crisp singing came to an abrupt end.
For no reason, Li Sushang activated Blade Mantra, freezing the Mind Lake into a huge piece of ice.
Thoughts sank below the water, like thousands of turbulent undercurrents.
The Mind Lake above was as clear as a mirror, illuminating everything.
Sushang suddenly felt as if she could predict the future. She knew that the door of the house was about to open, and the master walked towards her with the same indifference as before—

text.p: Lingshuang dragged her dull steps and walked slowly to Sushang's side.
There was no expression on her face, as if she was not interested in anything.

scene.text: Li Sushang looked at the master and smiled instinctively, as if driving away a lingering haze.
Lingshuang paused, blinking her eyes seemingly bored, and said:
